rComments: Not very approachable, is more disruptive than any late student because he pauses to call them out regularly. Prints a lot of unnecessary stuff out and handed out a class schedule instead of a syllabus, with no info on policy regarding late work. I appreciated the rubrics and exam outlines but a real syllabus would be infinitely better.

I really enjoyed taking Dr. Kavaler's class. He is very encouraging and asks open-ended questions, making it easy to respond. If you do your readings and attend lectures, you can do well in his class. He gives paper copies of his syllabus, research paper rubric, and midterm expectations (you can also access them online).
teacherRatingTags: ['Amazing lectures', 'Get ready to read', 'Graded by few things']

rComments: Lectures are useless, he printed out $60 readers even though all the readings can be found online. Asks "any thoughts?" on the readings and assumes you didn't read them if you don't say anything because it's so vague. Interrupts students answers halfway through. Didn't provide a syllabus or communicate outside of class via email or class site.
Margaret of Austria course-- he's amazingly nice and cute too!
Professor Kavaler is among the best in the Art History department at U of T. He's incredibly organized and likewise charming. I think he has a small fan base, which is kind of cute.
Simply excellent. Knowledgeable and communicates well and with some theatricality!
one of the most organized art history profs i've had (most tend to be too verbose and all over the place) explains everything in a clear, understandable manner.
The best!!

Amazing professor!  His knowledge on the subject is truly inpiring.  He is completely fair and extremely helpful with the course work and essays.  Although I took his courses several years ago, he is still one of the best professors I have had.

Prof. Kavaler is hugely knowledgeable and clearly loves what he teaches. I would not, however, call him the most approachable man. Some may consider him a very difficult marker (myself included) but, in truth, you will know you got the grade you deserved.
He is enthusiastic and very knowledgable!
amazing, fabulous, interesting and well-organized
I really liked him in FAH277, but in FAH307 I found his marking way too hard.  You're in trouble if he marks the exams/papers and not the TA.
All good.

Professor Kavalar was great! He really knew his stuff and knew how to teach it. He was very clear and to the point which made class notes very valuable in studying.  He was well-organized and didn't leave students hanging when it came to tests, essays and the exam. He was also very professional, a quality which is sometimes overlooked. Great class!
Hands down the beest prof I have ever had.
Just brilliant and funny
Nonsense! Very uncritical approach
Fantastic professor - very well organized and extremely knowledgable.  Can be somewhat intimidating, but my suggestion is to get over it!  He's fabulous!
It requires skills to make the students part of hte course and he has it. He also has a great sense of humor (especially his comments on the folly!) and is very approachable and helpful.
Best prof i've had so far. If only all profs were as well organized as him! Excellent lecturer.
TAKE HIS CLASSES! The man is a genius.
Great prof.

By far, one of the best lecturers in the department. His essay comments were really helpful. He was extremely well-organized and the tests were reasonable. I will definitely be taking his third-year course.
Cunning and Funny, yet VERy knowledgeable
Enthusiastic, well-planned lectures. He sparks your interest in the course!
Reminds me of "Niles" on Frasier- excellent lecturer, very organized
